SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Interface DbContextListableSelect<T extends DbContextListableSelect<T>>

All Superinterfaces:
DatabaseQueryable<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DbContextJoinedSelectBuilder, DbContextSelectBuilder, DbContextSqlBuilder
public interface DbContextListableSelect<T extends DbContextListableSelect<T>> extends DatabaseQueryable<T>
Interface to execute terminal operations for SELECT-statements. Usage: 
 try (DbContextConnection ignored = context.startConnection(dataSource)) {
     table.where...().list(row -> row.getUUID("column"));
     table.where...().single(row -> row.getLocalDate("column"));
 }

  • Method Details

    • orderBy

      @CheckReturnValue T orderBy(String orderByClause)
      Adds ORDER BY ... clause to the SELECT statement

    • getCount

      @CheckReturnValue int getCount()
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result

    • stream

      @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> Stream<OBJECT> stream(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream. Example: 
           table.where("status", status).stream(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • list

      @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> List<OBJECT> list(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list. Example: 
           List<Instant> creationTimes = table.where("status", status).list(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • listStrings

      @CheckReturnValue default List<String> listStrings(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list

    • listLongs

      @CheckReturnValue default List<Long> listLongs(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list

    • singleObject

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> SingleRow<OBJECT> singleObject(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      If the query returns no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
      Parameters:
      mapper - Function object to map a single returned row to a object
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

    • singleString

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<String> singleString(String fieldName)
      Returns a string from the specified column name
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

    • singleLong

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<Number> singleLong(String fieldName)
      Returns a long from the specified column name
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

    • singleInstant

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<Instant> singleInstant(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query. If there is no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if there is one result, returns it, if there are more than one result, throws IllegalStateException

    • singleInputStream

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<InputStream> singleInputStream(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query. If there is no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if there is one result, returns the binary stream of the object. Used with BLOB (Binary Large Objects) and bytea (PostgreSQL) data types

    • singleReader

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue default SingleRow<Reader> singleReader(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query. If there is no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if there is one result, returns the character reader of the object. Used with CLOB (Character Large Objects) and text (PostgreSQL) data types

    • forEach

      void forEach(DatabaseResult.RowConsumer consumer)
      Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row

    • limit

      @CheckReturnValue default T limit(int rowCount)
      Adds FETCH ... ROWS ONLY clause to the SELECT statement. FETCH FIRST was introduced in SQL:2008 and is supported by Postgresql 8.4, Oracle 12c, IBM DB2, HSQLDB, H2, and SQL Server 2012.

    • skipAndLimit

      @CheckReturnValue T skipAndLimit(int offset, int rowCount)
      Adds OFFSET ... ROWS FETCH ... ROWS ONLY clause to the SELECT statement. FETCH FIRST was introduced in SQL:2008 and is supported by Postgresql 8.4, Oracle 12c, IBM DB2, HSQLDB, H2, and SQL Server 2012.
